title: I’m writing an essay. When introducing an author of a book, what do I need to provide? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are using a book as a source in MLA style, you include the author’s full name and the title, in italics in the lead in, and page number in parentheses: According to John Smith in his book Why We Need More Gun Control, the United States has more guns in civilian hands than any other country (37). Then in the Works Cited, you give the full reference: Smith, John. Why We Need More Gun Control. Random House, 2018. If you want to give the author’s credentials, you add that in your lead-in: According to John Smith, author of Why We Need More Gun Control and a former Attorney General in New York as well as professor of Criminal Justice at El Camino College, the United States has more guns in civilian hands than any other country (37). If the author’s name is in the lead-in, all you need is the page number in parentheses (37) (ie, page 37). If you did not mention his name in the same sentence, you would put it in the parentheses. So later in the paragraph: (Smith 39)
